```{=html} ```
## Exercises 1. Write a function to raise to any power. You don't just want to square numbers, you want to raise them to higher powers too. Make a function that uses two arguments, `x` for a number, and `power` for the power. Call it `raise()`. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} raise <- function() { } # test with raise(x = 2, power = 4) # should give you 2^4 ``` ::: 2. Change your `raise()` function to default to squaring `x` when the user doesn't enter a value for `power`. ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} # test raise(x = 5) # should give you 5^2 ``` ::: ## Resources - [Advanced R](https://adv-r.hadley.nz/functions.html)
